newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Bank official confirms better Portugal growth.
newsitem.headline: Bank official confirms better Portugal growth.

text.p: The Bank of Portugal is more optimistic about the economy and sees 1996 growth at the higher end of its previous 1.75-2.75 percent range, a spokesman said.
He was confirming a report in the weekly Expresso magazine, which quoted Bank governor Antonio de Sousa as saying the central bank would slightly raise its growth forecast.
The spokesman said the new forecast, to be contained in the bank's October bulletin, would be for growth of 2.25-2.75 percent.
The government has forecast growth of 2.5-3.0 percent in 1996.
